intro: Hasseltia floribunda var. nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
